summary:
Tata Motors Share Price: A 37% Decline from All-Time High - Investor Insights for 2025

Updated Dec 26, 2024 from ET NOW News

Tata Motors shares have seen a strong correction, crashing over 37% in the past five months from their all-time high level, returning to levels not seen in a year. Investors are speculating on the stock's future performance as it currently trades below major moving averages.

  • Tata Motors yielded a negative return of nearly 6% in 2024, contrasting with the Sensex's 8.6% gain.
  • The significant decline is attributed to weak performance in commercial vehicles and EV sales, alongside pressures from Jaguar Land Rover.
  • Analysts suggest a potential bounce back may occur, fueled by favorable candlestick patterns and chart support.
  • Current trading at Rs 745.70, with recommendations to buy, maintaining a stop loss at Rs 717.
“There is a good expectation of a bounce back in Tata Motors.” - ET NOW Analyst

In conclusion, while Tata Motors has faced challenges, analysts remain optimistic about a potential recovery in share price moving into 2025.

title: Budget 2025: Money for country roads may take economy to a better place - The Economic Times
summary:
Budget 2025: Money for country roads may take economy to a better place

Publication Date: December 26, 2024
Source: Economic Times

As preparations for Budget 2025 gain momentum, the Indian government is set to focus on rural infrastructure, particularly roads, to stimulate economic growth and social inclusion.

  • The government is expected to increase funding for rural road development by nearly 10% in the upcoming budget.
  • The Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) will see an increase in its outlay, reflecting its importance in rural connectivity.
  • From 2000 to present, PMGSY has constructed approximately 769,284 km of roads, improving rural connectivity significantly.
  • The fourth phase of PMGSY aims to connect 25,000 habitations through 62,500 km of new roads.
  • Better rural roads are crucial for agriculture, enhancing market access and reducing post-harvest losses.
  • Improved roads are expected to boost rural consumption, job creation, and financial inclusion.
“Rural roads are more than just physical infrastructure; they are enablers of social and economic mobility.”

With a comprehensive approach to rural infrastructure in Budget 2025, India aims to unlock economic potential and reduce disparities, making rural development a cornerstone of its growth strategy.
newTitle: Budget 2025: Enhancing Rural Roads to Boost India's Economy

title: 2025 Honda Unicorn launched in India at Rs. 1.19 lakh - BikeWale
summary:

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Honda has launched the 2025 Unicorn in India, which is now compliant with OBD2B regulations and features several updates.

  • Complies with upcoming OBD2B regulations
  • Price increased by Rs. 8,180
  • Introduced new LED headlamp and a fully-digital instrument cluster

The motorcycle is priced at Rs. 1,19,481 (ex-showroom) and comes in three color options: Pearl Igneous Black, Matte Axis Gray Metallic, and Radiant Red Metallic. The previous Pearl Siren Blue color has been discontinued.

It is powered by an upgraded 162.71cc, single-cylinder engine producing 13bhp and 14.58Nm of torque, paired with a five-speed gearbox.

Furthermore, the motorcycle features a fully-digital instrument cluster with various indicators and a USB Type-C charging port.

title: Gold outshines equities in 2024: A look at the drivers behind the divergence - Upstox
summary:
Gold Outshines Equities in 2024: A Look at the Drivers Behind the Divergence

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Upstox

The year 2024 has seen a stark difference in performance between gold and equities, with gold delivering 20.5% YTD returns while equities produced a modest 8.9% YTD. This article explores the reasons behind these diverging trends.

  • Gold's Safe-Haven Appeal: Gold acted as a refuge during market uncertainty, resulting in higher demand.
  • Economic Factors: Increased consumer demand, particularly in India and China, has supported gold prices.
  • Policy Support: Changes to long-term capital gains tax have made gold investments more attractive.
  • Equities Underperform: Equities faced challenges like earnings slowdowns and inflation issues.
  • Market Outlook: Future performance for both asset classes is influenced by economic and geopolitical factors.
“2024 was a year in which gold proved its worth, emerging as one of the top-performing assets amid uncertainty.”

In conclusion, despite gold's outperformance, there is a potential for equities to recover if economic conditions improve. Investors should remain vigilant and consider diversification in their portfolios as the market evolves.
newTitle: Gold Outshines Equities in 2024: Trends and Insights

title: IRCTC Down? Passengers Unable To Book Tatkal Tickets Amid Massive Outage - Times Now
summary:
IRCTC Experiences Major Outage, Leaving Passengers Unable to Book Tatkal Tickets

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Times Now

The IRCTC application and website experienced a significant outage on Thursday, preventing many passengers from booking tickets during peak hours.

  • The outage was reported widely on social media, with many users expressing frustration.
  • Downdetector indicated a spike in outage reports for the IRCTC platform.
  • This is the second major outage in December, following a previous maintenance issue on December 9.
  • Tatkal booking for AC classes starts at 10 AM and for non-AC classes at 11 AM, making the timing crucial for many travelers.
“India reached the moon, but the Indian Railways ticket booking app can't handle Tatkal booking without crashing. It's 2024, and a stable server shouldn't be rocket science!”

Passengers are calling for improvements and accountability from IRCTC regarding the recurring issues with the ticket booking system.
newTitle: IRCTC Experiences Major Outage, Leaving Passengers Unable to Book Tatkal Tickets

summary:
NTPC Green Energy Share Price Drops 6% as Lock-In Period Ends

Publication Date: Thursday, Source: Mint

NTPC Green Energy share price declined nearly 6% in early trade after the one-month lock-in period for the company’s anchor investors expired.

  • Share price dropped as much as 5.93% to ₹125.20 on the BSE.
  • 1.83 crore shares (2% stake) became eligible for trade today.
  • The company raised ₹10,000 crore from its IPO.
  • NTPC Green Energy was listed on Indian stock exchanges on November 29.
  • IPO received strong demand, garnering 2.55 times subscription.
“The end of a lock-in period signifies that the shares will become eligible to be traded and does not mean that all the shares will be sold.”

Despite the drop, the stock remains above its issue price, reflecting ongoing investor interest in renewable energy sectors.

title: NTPC Green Energy shares in focus as 1-month lock-in period ends today - The Economic Times
summary:
NTPC Green Energy Shares Decline as Lock-In Period Ends

Publication Date: Today Source: The Economic Times

Shares of NTPC Green Energy fell up to 3% on Thursday to a low of Rs 128.25 as the 1-month shareholder lock-in period expired, allowing 183 million shares to trade in the market.

  • 183 million shares, representing about 2% of total outstanding shares, became eligible for trading.
  • The lock-in period is meant to stabilize stock prices by preventing sudden sell-offs from major investors.
  • Typically lasting six months but sometimes up to a year, the lock-in period supports a company’s long-term growth.
“This often leads to a temporary increase in selling pressure, potentially causing a drop in stock price.”

On Tuesday, NTPC Green Energy shares closed 1% lower at Rs 133.10 on the BSE.
newTitle: NTPC Green Energy Shares Decline as Lock-In Period Ends
